required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Different Membrane Applications in Vertical Ridge Augmentation
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Different Membrane Applications (Perforated Polytetrafluroethylene (PTFE) vs. Perforated PTFE+ Collagen Membrane) in Vertical Ridge Augmentation - Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This randomized clinical trial (RCT) study investigates if there is any difference in complication rate between perforated dense-polytetrafluroethylene (d-PTFE) mesh vs perforated d-PTFE mesh covered with a native collagen membrane.
The primary endpoint is complication rate. The secondary endpoints are regeneration rate and pseudoperiosteum formation.

primary_outcome.description: intrasurgical complications such as flap perforation, mesh exposure, postoperative infection, neurosensory disturbance,
Vertical and horizontal bone gain measured

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ridge Augmentation with a perforate PTFE mesh
arm_group.description: Vertical and horizontal ridge augmentation will be performed using d-PTFE mesh. The graft material is autograft mixed with a xenograft in a 1:1 ratio.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ridge Augmentation with a perforate PTFE mesh covered with a collagen membrane
arm_group.description: Vertical and horizontal ridge augmentation will be performed using d-PTFE mesh. The mesh will be covered with a native collagen membrane. The graft material is autograft mixed with a xenograft in a 1:1 ratio.

intervention.intervention_name: Guided bone regeneration with a PTFE membrane
intervention.description: Xenograft bovine spongious bone substitute mixed with autogenous intraorally harvested particulated bone is used and spatially contained with a PTFE membrane secured with Ti pins and screws.
intervention.arm_group_label: Ridge Augmentation with a perforate PTFE mesh

intervention.intervention_name: Guided bone regeneration with a PTFE+collagen membrane
intervention.description: Xenograft bovine spongious bone substitute mixed with autogenous intraorally harvested particulated bone is used and spatially contained with a PTFE membrane secured with Ti pins and screws and covered with a Collagen membrane subsequently.
intervention.arm_group_label: Ridge Augmentation with a perforate PTFE mesh covered with a collagen membrane

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Partially edentulous patients requiring vertical and horizontal ridge augmentation
2. patients agrees with conditions of the study and sign consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Insufficient oral hygiene
- Smoking
- Alcohol or Drug abuse
- acute local or systemic infections
- uncontrolled diabetes or other metabolic disease
- severe hepatic or renal disfunction
- autoimmune disease
- radiotherapy in the last 5 years
- patients receiving immunosuppressive therapy
